prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in high school would. You are given that $3^{400}\equiv 1\pmod{1000}$. What are the last three digits of $3^{12000}$?
solution:
The last three digits are the same as the remainder when divided by $1000$.

$3^{400}\equiv 1\pmod{1000}\implies 3^{12000}=(3^{400})^{30}\equiv 1^{30}=1\pmod{1000}$.

Thus, the last three digits are $\boxed{001}$.
gpt_response:
Given that $3^{400}\equiv 1\pmod{1000}$, we can write $3^{12000}$ as $(3^{400})^{30}$. Since $3^{400}\equiv 1\pmod{1000}$, we have that $(3^{400})^{30}\equiv 1^{30}\equiv 1\pmod{1000}$.

Therefore, the last three digits of $3^{12000}$ are $\boxed{001}$.

Therefore, the last three digits of $3^{12000}$ are $\boxed{001}$.
